issues.title: Elements must meet minimum color contrast ratio thresholds
issues.description: Ensure the contrast between foreground and background colors meets WCAG 2 AA minimum contrast ratio thresholds

any.message: Element has insufficient color contrast of 2.77 (foreground color: #ffffff, background color: #4caf50, font size: 10.0pt (13.3333px), font weight: normal). Expected contrast ratio of 4.5:1

nodes.failureSummary:
Fix any of the following:
  Element has insufficient color contrast of 2.77 (foreground color: #ffffff, background color: #4caf50, font size: 10.0pt (13.3333px), font weight: normal). Expected contrast ratio of 4.5:1

issues.title: This element has insufficient contrast at this conformance level. Expected a contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1, but text in this element has a contrast ratio of 2.78:1. Recommendation:  change background to #258829.
issues.description: <button type="submit">Subscribe</button>

original_issue.message: This element has insufficient contrast at this conformance level. Expected a contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1, but text in this element has a contrast ratio of 2.78:1. Recommendation:  change background to #258829.
original_issue.selector: html > body > div > div:nth-child(3) > div:nth-child(1) > div:nth-child(4) > form > button

issues.title: Document should have one main landmark
issues.description: Ensure the document has a main landmark

all.message: Document does not have a main landmark

nodes.failureSummary:
Fix all of the following:
  Document does not have a main landmark

issues.title: All page content should be contained by landmarks
issues.description: Ensure all page content is contained by landmarks

any.message: Some page content is not contained by landmarks

nodes.failureSummary:
Fix any of the following:
  Some page content is not contained by landmarks

issues.title: Links must be distinguishable without relying on color
issues.description: Ensure links are distinguished from surrounding text in a way that does not rely on color

any.message: The link has insufficient color contrast of 1.66:1 with the surrounding text. (Minimum contrast is 3:1, link text: #333333, surrounding text: #000000)
The link has no styling (such as underline) to distinguish it from the surrounding text

nodes.failureSummary:
Fix any of the following:
  The link has insufficient color contrast of 1.66:1 with the surrounding text. (Minimum contrast is 3:1, link text: #333333, surrounding text: #000000)
  The link has no styling (such as underline) to distinguish it from the surrounding text

issues.title: Links rely on color to be distinguishable.
issues.description: Low-contrast text is difficult or impossible for many users to read. Link text that is discernible improves the experience for users with low vision. [Learn how to make links distinguishable](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/link-in-text-block).

node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  The link has insufficient color contrast of 1.66:1 with the surrounding text. (Minimum contrast is 3:1, link text: #333333, surrounding text: #000000)
  The link has no styling (such as underline) to distinguish it from the surrounding text

automatic.name: Headings; Wrong Order, Empty & Missing Headings;

issues.title: Page should contain a level-one heading
issues.description: Ensure that the page, or at least one of its frames contains a level-one heading

all.message: Page must have a level-one heading

nodes.failureSummary:
Fix all of the following:
  Page must have a level-one heading

issues.title: Select element must have an accessible name
issues.description: Ensure select element has an accessible name

any.message: Element does not have an implicit (wrapped) <label>
Element does not have an explicit <label>
aria-label attribute does not exist or is empty
aria-labelledby attribute does not exist, references elements that do not exist or references elements that are empty
Element's default semantics were not overridden with role="none" or role="presentation"

nodes.failureSummary:
Fix any of the following:
  Element does not have an implicit (wrapped) <label>
  Element does not have an explicit <label>
  aria-label attribute does not exist or is empty
  aria-labelledby attribute does not exist, references elements that do not exist or references elements that are empty
  Element has no title attribute
  Element's default semantics were not overridden with role="none" or role="presentation"

issues.title: This select element does not have a name available to an accessibility API. Valid names are: label element, title undefined, aria-label undefined, aria-labelledby undefined.
issues.description:
<select>
                        <optio...</select>

original_issue.message: This select element does not have a name available to an accessibility API. Valid names are: label element, title undefined, aria-label undefined, aria-labelledby undefined.
original_issue.selector: html > body > div > div:nth-child(1) > div:nth-child(2) > div > select

issues.title: Select elements do not have associated label elements.
issues.description: Form elements without effective labels can create frustrating experiences for screen reader users. [Learn more about the `select` element](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/select-name).

node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Element does not have an implicit (wrapped) <label>
  Element does not have an explicit <label>
  aria-label attribute does not exist or is empty
  aria-labelledby attribute does not exist, references elements that do not exist or references elements that are empty
  Element has no title attribute
  Element's default semantics were not overridden with role="none" or role="presentation"

issues.title: This form field should be labelled in some way. Use the label element (either with a "for" attribute or wrapped around the form field), or "title", "aria-label" or "aria-labelledby" attributes as appropriate.
issues.description:
<select>
                        <optio...</select>

original_issue.message: This form field should be labelled in some way. Use the label element (either with a "for" attribute or wrapped around the form field), or "title", "aria-label" or "aria-labelledby" attributes as appropriate.
original_issue.selector: html > body > div > div:nth-child(1) > div:nth-child(2) > div > select

issues.title: This textinput element does not have a name available to an accessibility API. Valid names are: label element, title undefined, aria-label undefined, aria-labelledby undefined.
issues.description: <input type="text" placeholder="Search...">

original_issue.message: This textinput element does not have a name available to an accessibility API. Valid names are: label element, title undefined, aria-label undefined, aria-labelledby undefined.
original_issue.selector: html > body > div > div:nth-child(3) > div:nth-child(1) > input

issues.title: This form field should be labelled in some way. Use the label element (either with a "for" attribute or wrapped around the form field), or "title", "aria-label" or "aria-labelledby" attributes as appropriate.
issues.description: <input type="text" placeholder="Search...">

original_issue.message: This form field should be labelled in some way. Use the label element (either with a "for" attribute or wrapped around the form field), or "title", "aria-label" or "aria-labelledby" attributes as appropriate.
original_issue.selector: html > body > div > div:nth-child(3) > div:nth-child(1) > input

issues.title: This emailinput element does not have a name available to an accessibility API. Valid names are: label element, title undefined, aria-label undefined, aria-labelledby undefined.
issues.description: <input type="email" placeholder="type your email...">

original_issue.message: This emailinput element does not have a name available to an accessibility API. Valid names are: label element, title undefined, aria-label undefined, aria-labelledby undefined.
original_issue.selector: html > body > div > div:nth-child(3) > div:nth-child(1) > div:nth-child(4) > form > input

automatic.name: Size; Target Size; Element too small

issues.title: Touch targets do not have sufficient size or spacing.
issues.description: Touch targets with sufficient size and spacing help users who may have difficulty targeting small controls to activate the targets. [Learn more about touch targets](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/target-size).

node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Target has insufficient size (51px by 19px, should be at least 24px by 24px)
  Target has insufficient space to its closest neighbors. Safe clickable space has a diameter of 14.2px instead of at least 24px.
